void init_seq (  source *  s,

void on_expire (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
rtcp_event_t  e,
int  members,
int  senders,
double  rtcp_bw,
int  we_sent,
double *  avg_rtcp_size,
int *  initial,
double  tc,
double *  tp,
int *  pmembers
)  [static]
 

Called whenever the RTCP transmission timer has expired.

Parameters:
members estimated number of members in the current session
senders estimated number of senders in the current session
rtcp_bw The target RTCP bandwidth, i.e., the total bandwidth. that will be used for RTCP packets by all members of this session, in octets per second. This will be a specified fraction of the "session bandwidth" parameter supplied to the application at startup.
we_sent true if application has sent data since the second previous RTCP report was transmitted.
avg_rtcp_size The average compound RTCP packet size, in octets, over all RTCP packets sent and received by this participant. The size includes lower-layer transport and network protocol headers (e.g., UDP and IP).
initial flag that is true if the application has not yet sent an RTCP packet.
tc the current time.
tp the last time an RTCP packet was transmitted.
pmembers the estimated number of session members at the time tn was last recomputed.
See also:
static void rtcp_on_expire(rtcp_session_t* s)

void on_receive (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
rtcp_packet_t *  p,
rtcp_event_t  e,
int *  members,
int *  pmembers,
int *  senders,
double *  avg_rtcp_size,
double *  tp,
double  tc,
double  tn
)  [static]
 

Called whenever an RTCP packet is received.

Parameters:
s a pointer to the rtcp session block.
p a pointer to the received packet.
members estimated number of members in the current session.
pmembers the estimated number of session members at the time tn was last recomputed.
senders estimated number of senders in the current session
avg_rtcp_size The average compound RTCP packet size, in octets, over all RTCP packets sent and received by this participant. The size includes lower-layer transport and network protocol headers (e.g., UDP and IP).
tp the last time an RTCP packet was transmitted.
senders estimated number of senders in the current session.
tn the next scheduled transmission time of an RTCP packet.

int rtcp_add_member (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
rtcp_packet_t *  p
) 
 

Adds the member that sent packet p to the member tree.

Parameters:
m A pointer to the member tree.
s A pointer to packet sent by the new member.
Returns:
1: on success, 0: otherwise.

int rtcp_add_sender (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
rtcp_packet_t *  p
) 
 

Add a new sender to the sender "sublist" of the member tree. This function simply sets the sender flag for a member that is already in the list.

Parameters:
m A pointer to the member tree to add to.
p A pointer to a packet received from this sender.
Returns:
0: on success, -1 on failure.

int rtcp_destroy (  rtcp_session_t *  s  ) 
 

Destroy the rtcp_session_t and deallocate memory associated with its data structures.

Parameters:
s A pointer to the rtcp_session_t to be destroyed.
Returns:
0: on success.

gpointer rtcp_earliest_event (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
gpointer  t
) 
 

Retrieves a pointer to the earliest event in the event queue and removes the event from the queue.

Parameters:
s a pointer to the rtcp session block
t a pointer that will contain the time of the event after the function returns. This must point to pre-allocated memory.
Returns:
a pointer to the type of the event.

rtcp_member_t* rtcp_get_sender (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
const u_int32_t *  ssrc
)  [static]
 

int rtcp_init (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
double  rtcp_bw,
double  avg_rtcp_size,
u_int32_t  ssrc,
u_int32_t  sampling_frequency,
u_int32_t  samples_per_packet,
u_int32_t  bits_per_sample,
u_int32_t  sz_ctrl_rcv_buf,
u_int32_t  sz_ctrl_snd_buf
) 
 

Initializes a new rtcp_session_t object.

Parameters:
s A pointer to a rtcp_session_t object (already created).
rtcp_bw Target RTCP bandwidth (Bps).
avg_rtcp_size Average RTCP packet size (B).
ssrc 32 bit identifier used to identify this host when it is transmitting data.
sampling_frequency Source sampling frequency in KSamples/s.
samples_per_packet Total number of samples per packet.
bits_per_sample Number of bits per sample.
sz_ctrl_rcv_buf Size of control receive buffer.
sz_ctrl_snd_buf Size of control send buffer.
Returns:
0: if successful, -1: if not successful.

double rtcp_interval (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
int  members,
int  senders,
double  rtcp_bw,
int  we_sent,
double  avg_rtcp_size,
int  initial
)  [static]
 

Computes the deterministic calculated interval, measured in seconds.

Parameters:
s a pointer to the rtcp session block.
members estimated number of members in the current session.
senders estimated number of senders in the current session.
rtcp_bw The target RTCP bandwidth, i.e., the total bandwidth. that will be used for RTCP packets by all members of this session, in octets per second. This will be a specified fraction of the "session bandwidth" parameter supplied to the application at startup.
we_sent true if application has sent data since the second previous RTCP report was transmitted.
avg_rtcp_size The average compound RTCP packet size, in octets, over all RTCP packets sent and received by this participant. The size includes lower-layer transport and network protocol headers (e.g., UDP and IP).
initial flag that is true if the application has not yet sent an RTCP packet.
Returns:
current rctp interval (in seconds).

int rtcp_new_member (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
rtcp_packet_t *  p
) 
 

Determines if a member is in the member list or not.

Parameters:
m A pointer to the RTCP session.
p A pointer to a packet received from the member.
Returns:
1: if the participant is not currently in the members list, 0: otherwise.

int rtcp_new_sender (  rtcp_session_t *  s,
rtcp_packet_t *  p
) 
 

Determines if a sender is in the member list or not.

Parameters:
m A pointer to the member tree.
s A pointer to the ssrc that identifies the member to look for.
Returns:
1: if the participant who sent packet p is not currently in the sender "subtree" of the member tree, 0: otherwise.

void rtcp_on_expire (  rtcp_session_t *  s  ) 
 

Called whenever the RTCP transmission timer has expired. This function wraps the static function on_expire().

s a pointer to the rtcp session block
See also:

rtcp_packet_t *  p
) 
 

Called whenever an RTCP packet is received. This function wraps the static function on_receive().

p a pointer to the received packet.
See also:

u_int32_t rtcp_packet_seq (  rtcp_packet_t *  p  )  [static]
 

Returns the SSRC of the packet supplied. Performs the appropriate checks to ensure the packet has an SSRC (i.e. the packet is one of: PACKET_RTCP_REPORT, or PACKET_RTP).

Parameters:
s A pointer to the packet to be parsed.
Returns:
the seq of the packet. 0 is used to indicate an error.

u_int32_t rtcp_packet_ssrc (  rtcp_packet_t *  p  )  [static]
 

Returns the SSRC of the packet supplied. Performs the appropriate checks to ensure the packet has an SSRC (i.e. the packet is one of: PACKET_RTCP_REPORT, or PACKET_RTP).

Parameters:
s A pointer to the packet to be parsed.
Returns:
the SSRC of the packet. 0 is used to indicate an error.

rtcp_packet_type_t rtcp_packet_type (  rtcp_packet_t *  p  ) 
 

Determines the type of a packet. Note: Only weak validity checks are possible on an RTP/RTCP packet from a source that has not been heard before: o RTP version field must equal 2. o The payload type must be known.

Parameters:
s A pointer to the packet to be parsed.
Returns:
the packet type of the packet. Packet type is one of: PACKET_RTCP_REPORT, PACKET_RTP, PACKET_BYE, PACKET_INVALID.
See also:
rtcp_packet_type_t.

int rtcp_received_packet_size (  rtcp_packet_t *  p  )  [static]
 

Determines the size of a received packet.

Parameters:
s A pointer to the packet to be parsed.
Returns:
The size of the received packet.

rtcp_packet_t *  p
) 
 

Removes the member that sent packet p from the member tree.

Parameters:
m A pointer to the member tree.
s A pointer to packet sent by the member.
Returns:
1: on success, 0: otherwise.

Determines the size of packet generated and sent by event e.

Parameters:
s The event that generated the packet.
Returns:
The size of the sent packet.

rtcp_event_type_t rtcp_type_of_event (  rtcp_event_t  e  )  [static]
 

Determines the type of an event.

Parameters:
e The event we are interested in.
Returns:
The type of the event. Valid types include: EVENT_BYE, EVENT_REPORT.
